page.title: 04LIFE FOR A TYPICAL VILLAGER
page.content: MRS. Davies is a typical villager in Pontsticill,she gets up at about half past six every morning and goes to feed her animals in the garden.She has chickens and ducks which provide her with eggs,which are often difficult to find as there are laid in a large garden. About ten years ago the village shop and post office closed down and MRS.Davies found it difficult to keep going to Merthyr to do her shopping.In addition MRS.Davies is without a car and finds it difficult to relay on public transport which runs to and from Merthyr only every two hours. Often in the winter she has to stock up well with frozen food and sacks of potatoes as she often finds herself cut off.Four years ago MRS. Davies opened up her house as a bed and breakfast establishment.
